data.value: Every ability probably has a name.

data.name: AbilitiesWindow_NotesTextBox

data.name: AbilitiesWindow_RecoveryTextBox
data.value: How to replenish uses for this ability.

data.name: AbilitiesWindow_TypeComboBox
data.value: Which category list this ability comes from.

data.name: AbilitiesWindow_UsesTextBox
data.value: Amount of times this ability can be used before it is exhausted.

data.name: AppearanceWindow_AgeUpDown
data.value: A character should be older than 0, and probably at least the age of majority for their race.

data.name: AppearanceWindow_DistinguishingMarksTextBox
data.value: Give the character an unusual or memorable physical characteristic. Such as a scar, limp, or tattoo.

data.name: AppearanceWindow_EyeColorPreview
data.value: Select a distinctive eye colour.

data.name: AppearanceWindow_EyeColourTextBox
data.value: Select a distinctive eye colour.

data.name: AppearanceWindow_FeetUpDown
data.value: A strong and tough character might be tall or just heavy.

data.name: AppearanceWindow_GenderComboBox
data.value: Male, female, or even 'other' characters don't gain any special benefits or hindrances.

data.name: AppearanceWindow_HairColorPreview
data.value: Choose an interesting hair colour.

data.name: AppearanceWindow_HairColourTextBox
data.value: Choose an interesting hair colour.

data.name: AppearanceWindow_InchesUpDown
data.value: A strong and tough character might be tall or just heavy.

data.name: AppearanceWindow_SkinColorPreview
data.value: Select a reasonable skin colour. Or don't. I'm just text, I can't stop you.

data.name: AppearanceWindow_SkinColourTextBox
data.value: Select a reasonable skin colour. Or don't. I'm just text, I can't stop you.

data.name: AppearanceWindow_WeightUpDown
data.value: A weak but agile character might be thin.

data.name: Armor
data.value: Resources\Json\Armor.json;System.Byte[], mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089

data.name: ArmorWindow_ArmorClassUpDown
data.value: The armor's base AC without any modifiers added.

data.name: ArmorWindow_ArmorNameComboBox
data.value: This could be the generic type of armor equipped, or a spectacular named set of armor. Or anything in between.

data.name: ArmorWindow_MagicArmorClassUpDown
data.value: Total of any magic bonuses that affect Armor Class.

data.name: ArmorWindow_MiscArmorClassUpDown
data.value: Total of any status bonuses that affect Armor Class.

data.name: ArmorWindow_ShieldArmorClassUpDown
data.value: Wielding a shield normally increases AC by 2.

data.name: ArmorWindow_ShieldTextBox
data.value: Usually made from wood or metal and carried in one hand.

data.name: ArmorWindow_ShieldWeightUpDown
data.value: Generally weighs more than 0.

data.name: ArmorWindow_StatusComboBox
data.value: Unequipped armor will not provide any bonus or armor class improvements.

data.name: ArmorWindow_StealthComboBox
data.value: Determines if the wearer has disadvantage on stealth checks.

data.name: ArmorWindow_StrengthUpDown
data.value: Armor reduces speed by 10 unless the strength score is equal to or greater than listed score.

data.name: ArmorWindow_TypeComboBox
data.value: Light, Medium, or Heavy armor.

data.name: ArmorWindow_WeightUpDown
data.value: Contrary to popular belief, heavy armor will weigh more.

data.name: AttacksWindow_AbilityComboBox
data.value: Most weapons require strength to use, but finesse weapons allow a character to use their dexterity score. Special weapons or statuses might allow other abilities to be used instead.

data.name: AttacksWindow_AttackComboBox
data.value: Your race, class, and feats can grant you proficiency with certain weapons or categories of weapons.

data.name: AttacksWindow_AttunedCheckBox
data.value: Sets whether a character has bonded with this weapon, and if it counts towards the attunement limit.

data.name: AttacksWindow_CoinTypeComboBox
data.value: Specify the denomination so you don't have to worry about math.

data.name: AttacksWindow_DamageTextBox
data.value: List the damage rolls and proficiency bonus to attacking with this weapon.

data.name: AttacksWindow_DamageTypeComboBox
data.value: Some creatures and objects are exceedingly difficult or unusually easy to hurt with certain types of damage.

data.name: AttacksWindow_IgnoreWeightCheckBox
data.value: This is generally used to 'place' the weapon in a bag of holding.

data.name: AttacksWindow_MiscDamageTextBox
data.value: Here, you can use my plus 1 mace.

data.name: AttacksWindow_NotesTextBox
data.value: Many weapons have special properties related to their use, as shown in the Weapons table.

data.name: AttacksWindow_ProficencyOverrideCheckBox
data.value: Force this weapon to add your character's proficiency bonus.

data.name: AttacksWindow_RangeTextBox
data.value: How far you can strike enemies with this weapon. Ranged weapons have minimum and maximum effective ranges.

data.name: AttacksWindow_TypeComboBox
data.value: Specifying the type of weapon allows Concierge to automatically attempt to calculate proficiency bonuses. Most people can use simple weapons with proficiency, however, martial weapons require more specialized training to use effectively.

data.name: AttacksWindow_ValueUpDown
data.value: The worth of this weapon. Even your fists have value to someone.

data.name: AttacksWindow_WeightUpDown
data.value: Bro, do you even lift?

data.name: AttributesWindow_CharismaUpDown
data.value: Measures: Confidence, eloquence, leadership. Maximum of 30, but cannot be raised above 20 without special traits or equipment.

data.name: AttributesWindow_ConstitutionUpDown
data.value: Measures: Health, stamina, vital force. Maximum of 30, but cannot be raised above 20 without special traits or equipment.

data.name: AttributesWindow_DexterityUpDown
data.value: Measures: Physical agility, reflexes, balance, poise. Maximum of 30, but cannot be raised above 20 without special traits or equipment.

data.name: AttributesWindow_IntelligenceUpDown
data.value: Measures: Mental acuity, information recall, analytical skill. Maximum of 30, but cannot be raised above 20 without special traits or equipment.

data.name: AttributesWindow_StrengthUpDown
data.value: Measures: Natural athleticism, bodily power. Maximum of 30, but cannot be raised above 20 without special traits or equipment.

data.name: AttributesWindow_WisdomUpDown
data.value: Measures: Awareness, intuition, insight. Maximum of 30, but cannot be raised above 20 without special traits or equipment.

data.name: Augmentation
data.value: Resources\Json\Augmentation.json;System.Byte[], mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089

data.name: AugmentationWindow_BonusTextBox
data.value: Add any extra damage, status effects, or behaviors here.

data.name: AugmentationWindow_DamageTypeComboBox
data.value: Set the type of wound this projectile will cause.

data.name: AugmentationWindow_DescriptionTextBox
data.value: Many ammunition types have special properties related to their use, as shown in the ammunition table.

data.name: AugmentationWindow_EditIconButton
data.value: Set the icon that will be displayed in character sheet.

data.name: AugmentationWindow_NameComboBox
data.value: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack.

data.name: AugmentationWindow_QuantityUpDown
data.value: Carried amount of ammunition before starting an engagement.

data.name: AugmentationWindow_RecoverableCheckBox
data.value: At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

data.name: AugmentationWindow_TypeComboBox
data.value: Augment source that granted the ability.

data.name: AugmentationWindow_UsedUpDown
data.value: Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition.

data.value: Any extra information to help Danial so he remembers to rage.

data.name: ClassResourceWindow_PoolUpDown
data.value: Maximum available resources.

data.name: ClassResourceWindow_RecoveryComboBox
data.value: How fast can your character recover their spent resources.

data.name: ClassResourceWindow_ResourceNameComboBox
data.value: Not every class has resources to spend. Only the cool ones.

data.name: ClassResourceWindow_SpentUpDown
data.value: Currently used resources.

data.name: CompanionAttacksWindow_AbilityComboBox
data.value: Most weapons use strength, but some attacks allow a companion to use their dexterity score. Special weapons or statuses might allow other abilities to be used instead.

data.name: CompanionAttacksWindow_AttackComboBox
data.value: Your companion's race, class, and feats can grant you proficiency with certain weapons or categories of weapons.

data.name: CompanionAttacksWindow_DamageTextBox
data.value: List the damage rolls and proficiency bonus to attacking with this attack.

data.name: CompanionAttacksWindow_DamageTypeComboBox
data.value: Some creatures and objects are exceedingly difficult or unusually easy to hurt with certain types of damage.

data.name: CompanionAttacksWindow_MiscDamageTextBox
data.value: Here, you can use my plus 1 mace.

data.name: CompanionAttacksWindow_NotesTextBox
data.value: Many weapons have special properties related to their use, as shown in the Weapons table.

data.name: CompanionAttacksWindow_ProficencyOverrideCheckBox
data.value: Add your character's proficiency bonus to this attack.

data.name: CompanionAttacksWindow_RangeTextBox
data.value: How far you can strike enemies with this weapon. Ranged weapons have minimum and maximum effective ranges.

data.name: CompanionAttributesWindow_CharismaUpDown
data.value: Measures: Confidence, eloquence, leadership. Maximum of 30, but cannot be raised above 20 without special traits or equipment.

data.name: CompanionAttributesWindow_ConstitutionUpDown
data.value: Measures: Health, stamina, vital force. Maximum of 30, but cannot be raised above 20 without special traits or equipment.

data.name: CompanionAttributesWindow_DexterityUpDown
data.value: Measures: Physical agility, reflexes, balance, poise. Maximum of 30, but cannot be raised above 20 without special traits or equipment.

data.name: CompanionAttributesWindow_IntelligenceUpDown

data.name: CompanionWindow_AcUpDown
data.value: Total Armor Class of the companion.

data.name: CompanionWindow_CreatureSizeComboBox
data.value: In Soviet Russia, companion ride you.

data.name: CompanionWindow_InitiativeUpDown
data.value: Total initiative score for the companion.

data.name: CompanionWindow_MovementUpDown
data.value: Total movement speed for the companion.

data.name: CompanionWindow_NameTextBox
data.value: For example, an albino owl might be called "Al".

data.name: CompanionWindow_PerceptionUpDown
data.value: Total score to a companion's awareness.

data.name: CompanionWindow_VisionComboBox
data.value: Visual traits granted to the companion.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_BlindedCheckBox
data.value: Automatically fail any ability checks. Attack rolls against your character have advantage, your attacks have disadvantage.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_CharmedCheckBox
data.value: Your character cannot attack the charmer. The charmer has advantage on ability checks when interacting socially.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_DeafenedCheckBox
data.value: Your character cannot hear and automatically fails any ability check that requires hearing.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_DeathCheckBox
data.value: Your character must succeed on 3 death saving throws, before failing 3. Succeeding will stabilize at 0 HP.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_EncumbranceCheckBox
data.value: Override the automatically calculated encumbrance status.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_EncumbranceComboBox
data.value: A carry weight exceeding 5 and 10 times Strength will reduce speed by 10 and 20 respectively.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_FatiguedComboBox
data.value: Some special abilities and environmental hazards, such as starvation and the long-term effects of freezing or scorching temperatures, can lead to exhaustion. Exhaustion is measured in six levels.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_FrightenedCheckBox
data.value: Your character has disadvantage on Ability Checks and Attack rolls while the source of fear is within line of sight. You can’t willingly move closer to the source.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_GrappledCheckBox
data.value: Your character speed becomes 0. It ends when the grappler is incapacitated or you are thrown away.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_IncapacitatedCheckBox
data.value: Your character cannot react or take an action.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_InvisibleCheckBox
data.value: You are impossible to see without the aid of magic or a Special sense. Attacks against you have disadvantage, your attacks have advantage.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_ParalyzedCheckBox
data.value: Your character is incapacitated and automatically fail Strength and Dexterity Saving Throws. Attacks have advantage, and melee are auto crit.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_PetrifiedCheckBox
data.value: Transforms your character into an inanimate substance and are incapacitated. Resistant to all damage and immune to poison and disease.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_PoisonedCheckBox
data.value: You have disadvantage on Attack rolls and Ability Checks

data.name: ConditionsWindow_ProneCheckBox
data.value: Your only movement option is to crawl like a little bitch and have disadvantage on attacks. Melee attack is advantage, ranged is disadvantage.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_RestrainedCheckBox
data.value: Your speed becomes 0. Your attacks have disadvantage, enemies have advantage. Dexterity Saving Throws are disadvantage.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_StunnedCheckBox
data.value: You are incapacitated and speak falteringly, and automatically fail Strength and Dexterity Saving Throws. Attacks against have advantage.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_UnconsciousCheckBox
data.value: Your character is incapacitated, drop what you're holding, and fall prone. Attacks against have advantage and hits are auto crit.

data.name: EquipmentWindow_ItemComboBox
data.value: This item will be removed from your inventory to this page.

data.name: EquipmentWindow_SlotComboBox
data.value: Choose a location to equip the item to your character.

data.name: HealthWindow_CurrentHpUpDown
data.value: Current health from your pool remaining.

data.name: HealthWindow_TemporaryHpUpDown
data.value: Temporary bonus to HP. This might allow you to increase health beyond the normal maximum. Damage will drain from this pool first.

data.name: HealthWindow_TotalHpUpDown
data.value: The maximum health your character can heal to.

data.value: Maximum d6 hit dice available to be spent.

data.name: HitDiceWindow_TotalD8UpDown
data.value: Maximum d8 hit dice available to be spent.

data.value: Spend one or more d10 at the end of a short rest, up to the maximum.

data.name: HitDiceWindow_UsedD12UpDown

data.name: HitDiceWindow_UsedD6UpDown

data.name: HitDiceWindow_UsedD8UpDown
data.value: Spend one or more d8 at the end of a short rest, up to the maximum.

data.name: HpWindow_HpUpDown
data.value: The amount of healing or damage to take. 10 points to Gryffindor!

data.name: ImageWindow_ClearImageButton
data.value: Remove the stored image from the character sheet.

data.name: ImageWindow_FillTypeComboBox
data.value: Change how the image is stretched to fill the canvas.

data.name: ImageWindow_OpenImageButton
data.value: You can safely delete the image after loading it into Concierge.

data.name: ImageWindow_UseCustomImageCheckBox
data.value: Unchecking this won't delete a selected image.

data.value: Resources\Constants\Instrument.txt;System.String, mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089;utf-8

data.name: InventoryWindow_AmountUpDown
data.value: Eating Sixty-four slices of American Cheese might make you blind.

data.name: InventoryWindow_AttunedCheckBox
data.value: Spend time attuning to this item, allowing the use of special abilities. Your character can only attune to 3 items at a time.

data.name: InventoryWindow_CategoryComboBox
data.value: Specify the type of gear being carried.

data.name: InventoryWindow_CoinTypeComboBox
data.value: Specify the denomination so you don't have to worry about math.

data.name: InventoryWindow_ConsumableCheckBox
data.value: Indicates if the amount should decrease when the item is used.

data.name: InventoryWindow_DescriptionTextBox
data.value: Describe, in detail, why your character looted this item.

data.name: InventoryWindow_IgnoreWeightCheckBox
data.value: This is generally used to 'place' the item in a bag of holding.

data.name: InventoryWindow_NameComboBox
data.value: All item names are made up, if you stop to think about it.

data.name: InventoryWindow_NotesTextBox
data.value: Informs at a glance what this item is good for.

data.name: InventoryWindow_ValueUpDown
data.value: The worth of this item. Lisa, I'd like to buy your rock.

data.name: InventoryWindow_WeightUpDown
data.value: Is this item portable or luggable?

data.name: JournalWindow_DocumentTextBox
data.value: When we last left our heroes, Sir Schmoopy and Eluamus Nailo were searching for a magical herb to cure Schmoopy's dying grandmother...

data.name: Language
data.value: Resources\Json\Language.json;System.Byte[], mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089

data.name: LanguagesWindow_NameComboBox
data.value: Race indicates the languages a character can speak by default, and a background might give access to one or more additional languages.

data.name: LanguagesWindow_ScriptTextBox
data.value: The style of characters are used to write this language. Some languages are only spoken, and may not have a unique script.

data.name: LanguagesWindow_SpeakersTextBox
data.value: The races that are likely to speak a given language.

data.name: LevelExp
data.value: Resources\Constants\LevelExp.txt;System.String, mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089;utf-8

data.name: MagicClass
data.value: Resources\Json\MagicClass.json;System.Byte[], mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089

data.name: MagicClassWindow_AbilityComboBox
data.value: The ability used by the class to cast spells. For example Wizards, Artificers, and Druids are magic users that cast with Intelligence and Wisdom.

data.name: MagicClassWindow_CantripsUpDown
data.value: The amount of cantrips known the class at this level. These do not burn a spell slots when used.

data.name: MagicClassWindow_ClassNameComboBox
data.value: Choosing the right class for yourself AND your character will dictate the effectiveness of your character’s career.

data.name: MagicClassWindow_LevelUpDown
data.value: This class level determines the amount of usable spell slots, as well as the maximum spell level available.

data.name: MagicClassWindow_SpellsUpDown
data.value: The amount of total spells known to the class at this level.

data.name: Names
data.value: Resources\Json\Names.json;System.Byte[], mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089

data.name: PersonalityWindow_BondTextBox
data.value: Bonds represent a character's connections to people, places, and events in the world.

data.name: PersonalityWindow_FlawTextBox
data.value: Character flaws represent some vice, compulsion, fear, or weakness. Anything that someone else could exploit to cause you to act against your best interests.

data.name: PersonalityWindow_IdealTextBox
data.value: Ideals are things that you believe in most strongly, the fundamental moral and ethical principles that compel you to act as you do.

data.name: PersonalityWindow_NotesTextBox
data.value: Extra descriptions about a character's history.

data.name: PersonalityWindow_Trait1TextBox
data.value: They should be self-descriptions that are specific about what makes a character stand out.

data.name: PersonalityWindow_Trait2TextBox
data.value: They should be self-descriptions that are specific about what makes a character stand out.

data.name: ProficiencyWindow_ProficiencyComboBox
data.value: A character can be proficient in armors, weapons, or tools.

data.name: ProficiencyWindow_ProficiencyTextComboBox
data.value: The name of the armors, weapons, or tools that a characters is proficient in.

data.name: PropertiesWindow_AlignmentComboBox
data.value: A typical creature in the game world has an alignment, which broadly describes its moral and personal attitudes. Alignment is a combination of two factors: one identifies morality, and the other describes attitudes toward society and order.

data.name: PropertiesWindow_BackgroundComboBox
data.value: Every story has a beginning. Your character’s background reveals where you came from, how you became an adventurer, and your place in the world.

data.name: PropertiesWindow_Class1Class
data.value: Every adventurer is a member of a class. Class broadly describes a character’s vocation, what special talents he or she possesses, and the tactics he or she is most likely to employ.

data.name: PropertiesWindow_Class1Level
data.value: Typically, a character starts at 1st level and advances in level by adventuring and gaining experience points. A 1st-level character is inexperienced in the adventuring world

data.name: PropertiesWindow_Class1Subclass
data.value: Class is the primary definition of what your character can do, and Subclass refines it. It’s more than a profession; it’s your character’s calling.

data.name: PropertiesWindow_Class2Class
data.value: Every adventurer is a member of a class. Class broadly describes a character’s vocation, what special talents he or she possesses, and the tactics he or she is most likely to employ.

data.name: PropertiesWindow_Class2Level
data.value: Typically, a character starts at 1st level and advances in level by adventuring and gaining experience points. A 1st-level character is inexperienced in the adventuring world

data.name: PropertiesWindow_Class2Subclass
data.value: Class is the primary definition of what your character can do, and Subclass refines it. It’s more than a profession; it’s your character’s calling.

data.name: PropertiesWindow_Class3Class
data.value: Every adventurer is a member of a class. Class broadly describes a character’s vocation, what special talents he or she possesses, and the tactics he or she is most likely to employ.

data.name: PropertiesWindow_Class3Level
data.value: Typically, a character starts at 1st level and advances in level by adventuring and gaining experience points. A 1st-level character is inexperienced in the adventuring world

data.name: PropertiesWindow_Class3Subclass
data.value: Class is the primary definition of what your character can do, and Subclass refines it. It’s more than a profession; it’s your character’s calling.

data.name: PropertiesWindow_NameTextBox
data.value: Your character’s race description includes sample names for members of that race. Put some thought into your name even if you’re just picking one from a list.

data.name: PropertiesWindow_RaceComboBox
data.value: Every character belongs to a race, one of the many intelligent humanoid species in the D&D world. The most common player character races are dwarves, elves, halflings, and humans.

data.name: PropertiesWindow_SubRaceComboBox
data.value: Just like the common Antelope can have differences within their species, some races also have subraces, such as mountain dwarf or wood elf.

data.name: Race
data.value: Resources\Json\Race.json;System.Byte[], mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089

data.name: SavingThrowWindow_CharismaComboBox
data.value: Set if a charisma saving throw will have no bonuses, advantage, disadvantage, always fail, or will automatically be set.

data.name: SavingThrowWindow_ConstitutionComboBox
data.value: Set if a constitution saving throw will have no bonuses, advantage, disadvantage, always fail, or will automatically be set.

data.name: SavingThrowWindow_DexterityComboBox
data.value: Set if a dexterity saving throw will have no bonuses, advantage, disadvantage, always fail, or will automatically be set.

data.name: SavingThrowWindow_IntelligenceComboBox
data.value: Set if an intelligence saving throw will have no bonuses, advantage, disadvantage, always fail, or will automatically be set.

data.name: SavingThrowWindow_StrengthComboBox
data.value: Set if a strength saving throw will have no bonuses, advantage, disadvantage, always fail, or will automatically be set.

data.name: SavingThrowWindow_WisdomComboBox
data.value: Set if a wisdom saving throw will have no bonuses, advantage, disadvantage, always fail, or will automatically be set.

data.name: SensesWindow_BaseMovementUpDown
data.value: The distance a character can walk in 1 round. This number assumes short bursts of energetic movement in the midst of a life-threatening situation.

data.name: SensesWindow_InitiativeBonusUpDown
data.value: Intitiative determines the order of a turn during combat. A dexterity check sets a place in the initiative order.

data.name: SensesWindow_InspirationCheckBox
data.value: Inspiration dice are granted by the DM as a reward for roleplaying a character in a way that reflects their bonds, flaws, ideals, and personality traits.

data.name: SensesWindow_MovementBonusUpDown
data.value: Additional increase to a players maximum movement speed.

data.name: SensesWindow_PerceptionBonusUpDown
data.value: A characters ability to automatically notice details of their surroundings. This does not require a die roll.

data.name: SensesWindow_VisionComboBox
data.value: The most fundamental tasks of adventuring--noticing danger, finding hidden objects, hitting an enemy in combat, and targeting a spell, to name just a few--rely heavily on a character's ability to see.

data.name: SettingsWindow_AutosaveCheckBox
data.value: Concierge will automatically save at the set interval. This will always overwrite the current character.

data.name: SettingsWindow_AutosaveInterval
data.value: Sets the interval in minutes between autosaves.

data.name: SettingsWindow_CheckVersionCheckBox
data.value: This will check if a character was saved with a different major or minor version of Concierge.

data.name: SettingsWindow_CoinWeightCheckBox
data.value: Specifies if your money will weight you down.

data.name: SettingsWindow_DefaultOpenCheckBox
data.value: Will always open characters from the same directory.

data.name: SettingsWindow_DefaultSaveCheckBox
data.value: Will always save characters to the same directory.

data.name: SettingsWindow_EncumbranceCheckBox
data.value: Use encumbrance rules for your carry weight, based on the characters strength attribute.

data.name: SettingsWindow_HeaderAlignmentComboBox
data.value: Set how the text in the header bar is alighned. Everyone has different preferences.

data.name: SettingsWindow_HealingThreshold
data.value: Limits healing from rolling hit dice during a short rest. Will only regain hp until reaching the threshold. 100% will heal fully, 0% will disable auto healing.

data.name: SettingsWindow_MuteCheckBox
data.value: Toggle if button clicks and warning messages will play sound.

data.name: SettingsWindow_OpenTextBox
data.value: Default folder location for the "Open" dialog.

data.name: SettingsWindow_SaveTextBox
data.value: Default folder location for the "Save" dialog.

data.name: SettingsWindow_UnitOfMeasurementComboBox
data.value: D&D is unfortunatly designed for feet and pounds, but metric is always an option.

data.name: SettingsWindow_VolumeSlider
data.value: Set the application colume level when not muted.

data.name: SkillWindow_AcrobaticsComboBox
data.value: Set if an acrobatics check will have no bonuses, advantage, disadvantage, always fail, or will automatically be set.

data.name: SkillWindow_AnimalHandlingComboBox
data.value: Set if an animal handling check will have no bonuses, advantage, disadvantage, always fail, or will automatically be set.

data.name: SkillWindow_ArcanaComboBox
data.value: Set if an arcana check will have no bonuses, advantage, disadvantage, always fail, or will automatically be set.

data.value: Set if an athletics check will have no bonuses, advantage, disadvantage, always fail, or will automatically be set.

data.name: SkillWindow_DeceptionComboBox
data.value: Set if a deception check will have no bonuses, advantage, disadvantage, always fail, or will automatically be set.

data.name: SkillWindow_HistoryComboBox
data.value: Set if a history check will have no bonuses, advantage, disadvantage, always fail, or will automatically be set.

data.name: SkillWindow_InsightComboBox
data.value: Set if an insight check will have no bonuses, advantage, disadvantage, always fail, or will automatically be set.

data.name: SkillWindow_IntimidationComboBox
data.value: Set if an intimidation check will have no bonuses, advantage, disadvantage, always fail, or will automatically be set.

data.name: Spell
data.value: Resources\Json\Spell.json;System.Byte[], mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089

data.name: SpellSlotsWindow_Total1UpDown
data.value: The maximum amount of usable 1st level spells.

data.name: SpellSlotsWindow_Total2UpDown
data.value: The maximum amount of usable 2nd level spells.

data.name: SpellSlotsWindow_Total3UpDown
data.value: The maximum amount of usable 3rd level spells.

data.name: SpellSlotsWindow_Total4UpDown
data.value: The maximum amount of usable 4th level spells.

data.name: SpellSlotsWindow_Total5UpDown
data.value: The maximum amount of usable 5th level spells.

data.name: SpellSlotsWindow_Total6UpDown
data.value: The maximum amount of usable 6th level spells.

data.name: SpellSlotsWindow_Total7UpDown
data.value: The maximum amount of usable 7th level spells.

data.name: SpellSlotsWindow_Total8UpDown
data.value: The maximum amount of usable 8th level spells.

data.name: SpellSlotsWindow_Total9UpDown
data.value: The maximum amount of usable 9th level spells.

data.name: SpellSlotsWindow_TotalPactUpDown
data.value: The maximum amount of usable Pact spells.

data.name: SpellSlotsWindow_Used1UpDown
data.value: The number of remaining 1st level spell slots.

data.name: SpellSlotsWindow_Used2UpDown
data.value: The number of remaining 2nd level spell slots.

data.name: SpellSlotsWindow_Used3UpDown
data.value: The number of remaining 3rd level spell slots.

data.name: SpellSlotsWindow_Used4UpDown
data.value: The number of remaining 4th level spell slots.

data.name: SpellSlotsWindow_Used5UpDown
data.value: The number of remaining 5th level spell slots.

data.name: SpellSlotsWindow_Used6UpDown
data.value: The number of remaining 6th level spell slots.

data.name: SpellSlotsWindow_Used7UpDown
data.value: The number of remaining 7th level spell slots.

data.name: SpellSlotsWindow_Used8UpDown
data.value: The number of remaining 8th level spell slots.

data.name: SpellSlotsWindow_Used9UpDown
data.value: The number of remaining 9th level spell slots.

data.name: SpellSlotsWindow_UsedPactUpDown
data.value: The number of remaining Pact spell slots.

data.name: SpellWindow_AreaTextBox
data.value: Typically will be one of five different shapes: cone, cube, cylinder, line, or sphere.

data.name: SpellWindow_ClassComboBox
data.value: The magic class this spell is associated with. This allows auto-calculating of certain values.

data.name: SpellWindow_ComponentsTextBox
data.value: A spell's components are the physical requirements you must meet in order to cast it. Each spell's description indicates whether it requires verbal (V), somatic (S), or material (M) components.

data.name: SpellWindow_ConcentrationCheckBox
data.value: Some spells require you to maintain concentration in order to keep their magic active. If you lose concentration, such a spell ends.

data.name: SpellWindow_DamageTextBox
data.value: Your attack bonus with a spell attack equals your spellcasting ability modifier + your proficiency bonus.

data.name: SpellWindow_DurationTextBox
data.value: A spell's duration is the length of time the spell persists. A duration can be expressed in rounds, minutes, hours, or even years. Some spells specify that their effects last until the spells are dispelled or destroyed.

data.name: SpellWindow_LevelUpDown
data.value: Every spell has a level from 0 to 9. A spell's level is a general indicator of how powerful it is, with the lowly (but still impressive) magic missile at 1st level and the earth-shaking wish at 9th.

data.name: SpellWindow_NotesTextBox
data.value: Spells can be versatile tools, weapons, or protective wards. They can deal damage or undo it, impose or remove conditions, drain life energy away, and restore life to the dead.

data.name: SpellWindow_PreparedCheckBox
data.value: Before a spellcaster can use a spell, he or she must have the spell firmly fixed in mind, or must have access to the spell in a magic item.

data.name: SpellWindow_RangeTextBox
data.value: The target of a spell must be within the spell's range. For a spell like magic missile, the target is a creature. For a spell like fireball, the target is the point in space where the ball of fire erupts.

data.name: SpellWindow_RequireSpellSlotCheckBox
data.value: Some spells might be class or race abilitites, and not require expending spell slots in order to cast.

data.name: SpellWindow_RitualCheckBox
data.value: The ritual version of a spell takes 10 minutes longer to cast than normal. It also doesn't expend a spell slot, which means the ritual version of a spell can't be cast at a higher level.

data.name: SpellWindow_SaveTextBox
data.value: The DC to resist one of your spells equals 8 + your spellcasting ability modifier + your proficiency bonus + any special modifiers.

data.name: SpellWindow_SchoolComboBox
data.value: Academies of magic group spells into eight categories called schools of magic. These help describe spells; they have no rules of their own, although some rules refer to the schools.

data.name: SpellWindow_SpellNameComboBox
data.value: A discrete magical effect, a single shaping of the magical energies that suffuse the multiverse into a specific, limited expression.

data.name: StatusEffect
data.value: Resources\Json\StatusEffect.json;System.Byte[], mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089

data.name: StatusEffectsWindow_DescriptionTextBox
data.value: Resistance and then vulnerability are applied after all other modifiers to damage. Multiple instances of resistance or vulnerability that affect the same damage type count as only one instance.

data.name: StatusEffectsWindow_NameComboBox
data.value: Some creatures and objects are exceedingly difficult or unusually easy to hurt with certain types of damage.

data.name: StatusEffectsWindow_TypeComboBox
data.value: Having resistance to a damage type, damage of that type is halved against it. If a creature or an object has vulnerability to a damage type, damage of that type is doubled against it.

data.name: Subclass
data.value: Resources\Json\Subclass.json;System.Byte[], mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089

data.name: Subrace
data.value: Resources\Json\Subrace.json;System.Byte[], mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089

data.name: Tool
data.value: Resources\Constants\Tool.txt;System.String, mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089;utf-8

data.name: WealthWindow_Add1000Button
data.value: Add 1000 coins to the value.

data.name: WealthWindow_Add100Button
data.value: Add 100 coins to the value.

data.name: WealthWindow_Add10Button
data.value: Add 10 coins to the value.

data.name: WealthWindow_Add1Button
data.value: Add 1 coin to the value.

data.name: WealthWindow_AmountUpDown
data.value: Wealth appears in many forms in the world. Coins, gemstones, trade goods, art objects, animals, and property can reflect your character’s financial well-being.

data.name: WealthWindow_CpRadioButton
data.value: One silver piece is worth ten copper pieces, which are common among laborers and beggars. A single copper piece buys a candle, a torch, or a piece of chalk.

data.name: WealthWindow_EpRadioButton
data.value: The electrum piece originates from fallen empires and lost kingdoms, and they sometimes arouse suspicion and skepticism when used in transactions. An electrum piece is worth five silver pieces.

data.name: WealthWindow_GpRadioButton
data.value: With one gold piece, a character can buy a bedroll or 50 feet of good rope. A skilled artisan can earn one gold piece a day. The gold piece is the standard unit of measure for wealth, even if the coin itself is not commonly used.

data.name: WealthWindow_MinusButton
data.value: Why couldn't I have 3 money and no kids?

data.name: WealthWindow_PlusButton
data.value: Money can be exchanged for goods and services.

data.name: WealthWindow_PpRadioButton
data.value: The platinum piece originates from fallen empires and lost kingdoms, and they sometimes arouse suspicion and skepticism when used in transactions. A platinum piece is worth ten gold pieces.

data.name: WealthWindow_SpRadioButton
data.value: One gold piece is worth ten silver pieces, the most prevalent coin among commoners. A silver piece buys a laborer's work for half a day, a flask of lamp oil, or a night's rest in a poor inn.

data.name: Weapon
data.value: Resources\Json\Weapon.json;System.Byte[], mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089
